ygData.messageBody:
These is what I noticed.
If you have an ability (not only on spells) from level 1, it can increase by
itself. When you have a new ability, you must spend at least one practice
point to learn it. And your guildmaster says "You have learnt the basics
of...". It seems that you then have a base that equals to your level. THEN
it can increase by itself. But it sometimes depends of the ability. For
example, some people think that Safe Fall for the monk never increases
except with practive points.

Erwin, Paladin of Tunare
Fennin Ro

One thing that I have noticed, (correct me if I am wrong), is that if I
haven't practiced at least one time with my Guildmaster on a type of spell
(abjuration for instance) my experience does not increase in that spell type
until I do. So it may seem that you can't use a spell or that it is not
working well, but you need to practice it with the Guildmaster at least once
to kind of "kick start" the spell. This is the way it has worked for me.
If anyone has any more information on practicing and spells, let me know. I
am just about to go to level 11 and will be curious as to where to utilize
my practices.

Grod
10th Level Paladin (almost 11)
Innoruuk Server
